channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Dr. Peter Hotez takes the war against science very personally
item.description: In an interview about the new book he co-authored, Science Under Siege, Hotez talks about forces driving the anti-science movement, the risks it poses...

item.title: NATO Says It Scrambled Fighter Jets to Shoot Down Russian Drones Over Poland
item.description: The incursion was the first time alliance planes had engaged enemy targets in NATO airspace. Poland’s leader called it “a large-scale provocation.”

item.title: Republicans Race to Advance Stephen Miran, Trump’s Fed Pick, Despite White House Ties
item.description: Stephen Miran, a top economic adviser to the president, cleared a key Senate hurdle on Wednesday, putting him one step closer to a seat on the Federal...

item.title: California considers allowing doctors to prescribe abortion drugs anonymously
item.description: If passed, the law would protect doctors from legal risk by letting them omit their names from prescription labels for abortion pills. It would affect...

item.title: Facing Israeli Assault, Many in Gaza City Say Fleeing Again Is Worse
item.description: Israel has ordered hundreds of thousands of people to evacuate the city and go to the southern Gaza Strip, but many residents say it is no safer for t...

item.title: Israel targets Hamas Qatar strike. And, JB Pritzker on Trump's threats to Chicago

item.title: By listening to these birds for decades, scientists track signs of a changing forest
item.description: Scientists tracking the birds in an experimental forest in New Hampshire have also tracked changes in the forest ecosystem over decades.

item.title: New Yorkers Support Free Buses, but They Don’t Think It Should Happen
item.description: A polling experiment shows how a small change in wording can make a big difference.

item.title: Poland Has Invoked NATO’s Article 4. What Comes Next?

item.title: Greetings from a peaceful woodland near the River Thames west of London
item.description: Far-Flung Postcards is a weekly series in which NPR's international team shares moments from their lives and work around the world.

item.title: Happy 10th Birthday to the Laser Interferometer Gravitational-Wave Observatory. Now Drop Dead.
